message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the boiling point of water. When the boiling point of water is attained, the water turns into water vapor and rapidly evaporates. Option (B) is incorrect because the boiling point is above the freezing point, so the water will not solidify. Option (C) is also incorrect because boiling water does not turn black. Therefore, the correct answer is option (A) - the water evaporates rapidly.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of water and the phase changes it undergoes at different temperatures. When the boiling point of water is attained, the water turns into vapor and rapidly evaporates. Option (B) is incorrect because water does not solidify when it reaches its boiling point. Option (C) is incorrect because the color of water does not change when it reaches its boiling point. Since only option (A) is correct, the answer is (A).

To answer this question, we need to understand the boiling point of water and what happens when it is reached. When water reaches its boiling point, it starts to turn into vapor or steam and evaporates rapidly. This is because the heat energy is causing the water molecules to move faster and break free from the liquid state. Option (B) is incorrect because solidification occurs when water reaches its freezing point, not its boiling point. Option (C) is incorrect because boiling water does not turn black, it only changes from a liquid to a gas. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) - the water evaporates rapidly.
